name: Microtel Inn & Suites by Wyndham Brunswick North

reviews.text: I have stayed at multiple Microtel locations. The one off exit 38 proves to be the best. The young staff uplifts spirits and makes you feel young again. The place is beautifully furnished. I really enjoyed the pool. It was crystal clear and my room was spotless. After all the renovating, this place went from a 4 to a 10!!!! The mini breakfast was small but had a lot of choices. I would like to thank the staff for all their help in making my stay comfy. Special thanks to Britt at the front desk, she was so helpful in finding me menus and great nearby attractions.
reviews.title: Great Value, and comfy!!!

reviews.text: This hotel is located in a great location with quick and easy access to I-95 and the local communities of Brunswick, St. Simons and Jekyl Islands for those on a budget. The staff is very frendly and courteous; in fact as I walked into the hotel lobby to register, I was greeted by name by the receptionist. The hotel is beautifully landscaped and provides a great place to also stop over if travling along I-95.
reviews.title: A Great Value when Visiting the Golden Isles

reviews.text: On July 12th our family traveled to Jekyll Island to be spend a day at the Summer Waves Waterpark and on the way back to Back to Brunswick our car broke down. We found the Microtel Inn to stay at for the night and found out that we had actually made reservations at the other Microtel in Brunswick (south) BUT beings that we had a broke down car, the Microltel Inn North switched our reservations without charging us. The guy Greg at the counter even though we were a little panicked was VERY calm and reassuring and gave us a lower rate than the other Microtel considering our predicament. He also was very kind and empathetic. The room was VERY clean, comfortable and the pool was nice. The next day a black lady at the counter ( I can remember her name she had a funny name) said that she would give us until 12 to check out without an extra late charge because of our situation even though we were supposed to check out at 11am. The continental breakfast also was good with a nice variety. Well, we checked out a little after 12 but never got our car back until about 12:45. She stood there with us and talked to us and tried to make sure we were ok and comfortable. We couldn't have asked for better hospitality! I would highly recommend this Microtel and we will definitley be back for our next stay in Brunswick!
reviews.title: Staff was awesome and very helpful!!! We'll definitely be back!

reviews.text: breakfast had a variety, pancakes, cerael fruit, juice. staff was very friendly and pool was nice, also had laundry facility for a small price
reviews.title: had fun!!

reviews.text: I arrived on a Saturday afternoon and the hotel looked quiet nice on the outside and the rooms were very clean and nice.The staff was friendly and willing to help.Breakfast was good. Now the bad...The beds will kill you.They looked old and outdated,slept like a concrete floor.When I advised the staff they were aware that others had complained about them also..Thay were unable to provide extra pillows and one last thing,The pool was a mess with leaves and dirt.Overall we still had a great time even without the much needed rest.
reviews.title: NEEDS SOME TLC!
I did not stay in the same Microtel as "ya'll" said was great....
reviews.text: I stopped in for a one night "passing through". From the goth chick at the front desk too busy with her Angry Birds, not acknowledging the online priced quote, the dirty pillows, and no shampoo or conditioner, or the cold coffee and the most pathetic continental breakfast I've seen in a while. (What continent by the way, a third world continent I'm guessing). No wonder there were only about 5 cars in the huge parking lot....I should have known better. PLEASE do yourself a favor and go elsewhere. The WORST Microtel I've ever stayed in. Everything was cheap, and poorly done. The apology from the day "manager?" was too little too late.
Do yourself the favor of going one more exit (exit 36), where there are many more options, and I'm sure a nicer, and lower priced room for the money.
reviews.title: Such a great visit!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I recently stayed at this hotel and it was so lovely. It was clean..and cute and while some of the desk clerks really need to work on their hygeine..the girl , Janet, at the desk was fabulous! So polite and helpful I really would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a place to stay!
reviews.title: Not one of the better Microtels

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Granted, Microtel is generally a budget motel, but this one had second-rate breakfast, was a little dirtier than is typical. Decent enough for a single night, but I wouldn't use this as a base to explore the area.
reviews.title: felt at home immediately

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We only spent one night here, but I felt so absolutely welcome there! I chatted a little with the lady at the front desk, she was very friendly and helpful. I also liked the room - the bathroom was clean, and the room big enough, too. Breakfast good, wifi worked - wouldn´t know what else to ask for!
reviews.title: not bad but not great either

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel, along with 10 others, during April 2012 as part of a 17 day road trip across GA, NC, SC. By giving the star rating I am not saying the hotel is a 3 star but whether it was clean and value for the money and to an extent we have compared then to the other 10 hotels we stayed at.
reviews.title: Adequate

reviews.text: Unlike some others this Microtel Inn was more like a traditional hotel were you park as near the reception as possible and take your luggage through the reception to a lift to your room. This felt much safer to us than the motel types were your room door is accessible to all from the street.
reviews.title: Pet friendly and affordable with added perks!!

reviews.text: On arrival we were allocated a one queen bedded room when we had booked a two queen bedded room. The reception stated that we had not booked that room and after showing the email confirmation we were told that there were no two bedded rooms available. Only after requesting that the booking be cancelled and we would stay elsewhere did a room (321) suddenly become available. There was much confusion at reception with other guests having missed bookings and wrong rates.
reviews.title: Front Desk

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Things then went well until the next day when returning from a day out the lift was out of order and we had to walk up three flights of stairs only to find our room key card was also not working and we had to walk back down to reception and then back up again
reviews.title: Best on I95

reviews.text: The original room offered was described as an "upgrade to a suite" but it was a just a one bedded queen with a settee squeezed in. The 2 bedded room was much better. Clean towels and variable hot water. Sometimes the hot water went cold while having a shower
reviews.title: Great place at great price

reviews.text: The night manager Ben Davis was extremely helpful and courteous. He is a true professional and cares about making the guests stay as comfortable as possible.

description: This is a Southern gem! *NEW*Saltwater-Mineral Swimming pool open til' 12 AM. Directly off I-95 exit 38. New hotel on exit. *New* Nightly "Social Hour" with nacho's & fresh baked Otis Spunkmeyer® cookies every evening for your enjoyment, as well as our 24 hour coffee bar, fresh fruit citrus refreshment center. 24 hour ice cream room service is available with free bedside candy waiting for you! Start your morning off right with our free deluxe hot breakfast buffet including sausage, eggs, biscuits, french toast, make your own Belgian waffles, six different cereals, fruits cups, sugar free syrup and much more, over 25 items in all. We have free Wi-Fi Internet access in all public areas and rooms, plus a 24 hour business center. For your indulgence we also have a 24 hour Georgia Gift Shop located in the lobby, barbeque patio and game room featuring a foosball table and darts .Each spacious queen and/or double queen guest room is equipped with Triple Sheeted bedding, premium signature "Wolfgang Puck" in-room coffee, high-speed Internet access, microwave, refrigerator and expanded cable television with HBO®. DVD players are also available.Guests of the Microtel Inn & Suites-Brunswick may also enjoy visiting local museums or area festivals. Guests may also choose to take a day trip to the beach of Brunswick. The hotel provides the ideal rest stop for travelers driving between south Florida and northern or mid-western states. Hotel guests will appreciate a host of nearby dining options.
